IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ADVANCE THE QUALITY OF SERVICES, IMAGE, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND THE FINANCIAL STABILITY OF ITS MEMBERS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO ADVANCE THE QUALITY OF SERVICES, IMAGE, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND THE FINANCIAL STABILITY OF ITS MEMBERS.
IRS990.Desc: ANNUAL CONFERENCE - MEMBERS CAN HEAR SPEAKERS CONCERNED WITH HEALTH CARE ISSUES AND VIEW EXHIBITS OF GOODS AND SERVICES FOR IMPROVED HEALTHCARE OPERATIONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATION - ASSOCIATION CONDUCTS CONTINUING EDUCATION, SEMINARS AND WORKSHOPS IN VARIOUS FLORIDA CITIES TO HELP NURSING HOME ADMINISTRATORS AND STAFF IMPROVE PROFESSIONAL COMPETENCE.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: SENIOR DIRECTOR OF POLICY AND REIMBURSEMENT
DIRECTOR OF CLINICAL AND RISK MANAGEMENT

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FHCA IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(6) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE ("IRC"), AND THE FOUNDATION IS EXEMPT UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE IRC. SERVICE CORP IS TAXED AT REGULAR CORPORATE RATES, AND PAC IS SUBJECT TO INCOME TAXES ON INVESTMENT INCOME. FHCA IS SUBJECT TO TAXES ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME, PRIMARILY ON ITS ADVERTISING REVENUE. THESE ACTIVITIES AND THE ACTIVITIES OF PAC, OFEC, THE COUNCIL, AND FQHC RESULTED IN NO INCOME TAX LIABILITY FOR THE YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2021 AND 2020. THE ACTIVITIES OF SERVICE CORP RESULTED IN AN INSIGNIFICANT INCOME TAX LIABILITY FOR THE YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2021 AND 2020, RESPECTIVELY. AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2021, WITH CERTAIN LIMITED EXCEPTIONS, FHCA AND ITS AFFILIATES ARE NO LONGER SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX EXAMINATION BY UNITED STATES FEDERAL TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR ANY TAX YEARS PRIOR TO THE THREE MOST RECENT TAX YEARS.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: SENIOR DIRECTOR OF POLICY AND REIMBU

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHARTER TRAVEL: WHEN WARRANTED AND AVAILABLE, THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR USES A CHARTER AIRLINE. THE COST OF THE TRAVEL IS CONFIRMED BY COMMERCIAL RECEIPTS TO BE EITHER THE SAME OR LESS COST THAN STANDARD AIRFARE. PART I, LINE 1A: TRAVEL FOR COMPANIONS: THE PRESIDENT/CHAIRMAN, SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR ARE GRANTED REASONABLE TRAVEL ALLOWANCES FOR COMPANIONS TO ATTEND EVENTS SANCTIONED BY THE ORGANIZATION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S BY-LAWS.

KEY EXECUTIVES (EMMETT REED) PARTICIPATE IN A NONQUALIFIED, DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN UNDER IRC, SEC. 457(B). FHCA MADE CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE PLAN IN THE AMOUNT OF $10,000 FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2021. THESE AMOUNTS ARE SUBJECT TO CREDITOR CLAIMS BUT HAVE BEEN DEPOSITED FOR THE PARTICIPANTS' BENEFIT WITH A THIRD-PARTY ADMINISTRATOR. THE PARTICIPANTS AND PLAN TRUSTEE DIRECT INVESTMENT DECISIONS FOR FUNDS DEPOSITED ON THE PARTICIPANTS' BEHALF.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS SEVERAL CLASSES OF MEMBERS. SKILLED NURSING FACILITY AND ASSISTED LIVING FACILITY MEMBERS ARE THE ONLY CLASSES OF MEMBERS THAT HAVE VOTING RIGHTS. EACH FACILITY IS GIVEN ONE VOTE WHICH IS TYPICALLY EXERCISED BY THE ADMINISTRATOR OF THE FACILITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FACILITY MEMBERS ARE THE ONLY CLASS OF MEMBER WHICH HAVE VOTING RIGHTS. THE NATURE OF THE RIGHTS FOR THIS CLASS INCLUDE VOTING FOR STATEWIDE OFFICERS AND APPROVING THE ANNUAL BUDGET, AS WELL AS ANY MEMBERSHIP DUES CHANGES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DECISIONS OF THE GOVERNING BODY THAT ARE SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY THE VOTING MEMBERS INCLUDE APPROVAL OF THE ANNUAL BUDGET AND ANY MEMBERSHIP DUES CHANGES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE 990 IS PROVIDED TO MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR MONITORS PROPOSED OR ONGOING CONFLICTS AND DISCLOSES THEM TO THE BOARD PRESIDENT IN ORDER TO DEAL WITH POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS, WHETHER DISCOVERED BEFORE OR AFTER THE TRANSACTION HAS OCCURRED. FOR EACH CONFLICT DISCLOSED TO THE BOARD PRESIDENT, APPROPRIATE ACTION IS TAKEN BASED ON THE NATURE OF THE CONFLICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED BY AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION/MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE AND IS BOUND BY AN EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT. THE COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED USING COMPARABLE COMPENSATION DATA FOR SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS IN FUNCTIONALLY COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT SIMILARLY SITUATED ORGANIZATIONS. THERE IS CONTEMPORANEOUS DOCUMENTATION AND RECORDKEEPING WITH RESPECT TO THE DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS REGARDING THE COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN NET ASSETS - OTHER DISTRICT ACTIVITY -42,542.

OVERSIGHT OF AUDIT: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ASSUMES THE RESPONSIBILITY OF OVERSEEING THE AUDIT AND SELECTION OF THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT, AS THERE IS NO DESIGNATED AUDIT COMMITTEE. THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
